description: Since r390, we don't have (or need) a FAKE_subdomain flag any longer, yet the docs refer to it several times. Let's get rid of that.
title: Stop referring to FAKE_subdomain in docs

comments.content: Since r390, we don't have (or need) a FAKE_subdomain flag any longer, yet the docs refer to it several times. Let's get rid of that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content: Removed all references in the wiki, searched on nova.openstack.org and there are no references, I consider it done unless there are other references I need to find. Let me know if you see more.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~annegentle

comments.content: I went through and removed all references to FAKE_subdomain in everything but the doctree files (I don't trust editing them in vim). The branch is linked to this ticket and is ready for review.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0

comments.content:
I'm currently trying to get familiar with OpenStack and came across the "FAKE_subdomain" option in the docs here:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/starter/content/Nova_conf-d2s367.html

If it isn't in use anymore, maybe it should be removed there as well?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philwo
